tit.e: Tokaidochu Hizakurige (Foot Travelers along the Tokai-do Road)
Tokaidochu Hizakurige (Foot Travelers along the Tokai-do Road)
Tokaidochu Hizakurige (Foot Travelers along the Tokai-do Road)

sen.j: 東海道中膝栗毛（とうかいどうちゅうひざくりげ）は、1802年（享和2年）から1814年（文化 (元号)11年）にかけて初刷りされた、十返舎一九の滑稽本である。
sen.e: Tokaidochu Hizakurige is a book of comical stories by Ikku Jippensha, with their first printings taking place between 1802 to 1814.
Tokaidochu Hizakurige is a book of comical stories by Ikku JUPPENSHA, with their first printings taking place between 1802 to 1814.
sen.cmt: 「十返舎一九」の名前の表記を、用語集を参照して修正しました。
sen.e: Tokaidochu Hizakurige is a book of comical stories by Ikku JUPPENSHA, with their first printings taking place between 1802 to 1814.

sen.j: 後続の『続膝栗毛』は、1810年（文化7年）から1822年（文政5年）にかけて刊行された。
sen.e: The sequel, "Zoku Hizakurige" (Hizakurige, continued) was published between 1810 to 1822.
The sequel, "Zoku Hizakurige" (Hizakurige, continued) was published between 1810 to 1822.
The sequel, "Zoku Hizakurige" (Hizakurige, continued) was published between 1810 to 1822.

sen.j: 大当たりして、今に至るまで読みつがれている。
sen.e: It was a great hit, and it still continues to be read to this day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was a great hit, and it still continues to be read to this day.
It was a great hit, and it still continues to be read to this day.

sen.j: 主人公の弥次郎兵衛と喜多八、繋げて『弥次喜多』は、派生する娯楽メディア類に、なお活躍している。
sen.e: The main characters, Yajirobe and Kitahachi, called "Yaji Kita" together, still remain popular in the entertainment media that have their origins in this series.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The main characters, Yajirobe and Kitahachi, called "Yaji Kita" together, still remain popular in the entertainment media that have their origins in this series.
The main characters, Yajirobe and Kitahachi, called "Yaji Kita" together, still remain popular in the entertainment media that have their origins in this series.

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Outline

sen.j: 『栗毛』は栗色の馬。
sen.e: "Kurige" means a chestnut-colored horse.
"Kurige" means a chestnut-colored horse.
"Kurige" means a chestnut-colored horse.

sen.j: 『膝栗毛』とは、自分の膝を馬の代わりに使う徒歩旅行の意である。
sen.e: "Hizakurige" means foot travelers who use their own legs instead of horses.
"Hizakurige" means foot travelers who use their own legs instead of horses.
"Hizakurige" means foot travelers who use their own legs instead of horses.

sen.j: 江戸八丁堀 (東京都中央区)の住人栃面屋弥次郎兵衛（とちめんや やじろべえ）と、居候の喜多八（きたはち）が、厄落としに伊勢神宮を思い立ち、東海道を江戸から伊勢神宮へ、さらに京都、大坂へとめぐる。
sen.e: Yajirobe TOCHIMENYA, a resident of Edo Hatchobori (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kitahachi, his freeloader, decide to visit Ise-jingu Shrine to get rid of their bad luck, and they travel the Tokai-do road from Edo to Ise-jingu Shrine, and further on to Kyoto and Osaka.

Yajirobe TOCHIMENYA, a resident of Edo Hatchobori (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kitahachi, his freeloader, decide to visit Ise-jingu Shrine to get rid of their bad luck, and they travel the Tokai-do road from Edo to Ise-jingu Shrine, and further on to Kyoto and Osaka.

Yajirobe TOCHIMENYA, a resident of Edo Hatchobori (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) and Kitahachi, his freeloader, decide to visit Ise-jingu Shrine to get rid of their bad luck, and they travel the Tokai-do road from Edo to Ise-jingu Shrine, and further on to Kyoto and Osaka.

sen.j: 道中の二人は、狂歌・駄洒落・冗談をかわし合い、いたずらを働き失敗を繰り返し、行く先々で騒ぎを起こす。
sen.e: Along the journey, the two of them compose kyogen verses (satirical tanka (poem consisting of thirty-one syllables) verses) and create puns and jokes, play pranks, repeatedly making mistakes and creating a riot wherever they go.

Along the journey, the two of them compose kyogen verses (satirical tanka (poem consisting of thirty-one syllables) verses) and create puns and jokes, play pranks, repeatedly making mistakes and creating a riot wherever they go.

Along the journey, the two of them compose kyogen verses (satirical tanka (poem consisting of thirty-one syllables) verses) and create puns and jokes, play pranks, repeatedly making mistakes and creating a riot wherever they go.

sen.j: 経緯
sen.e: How the book came about
How the book came about
How the book came about

sen.j: 一九は寛政7年（1795年）から、職業作家として多くの黄表紙ほかを出していたが、まだ大ヒットはなかった。
sen.e: Ikku published many illustrated books of popular tales as a professional writer since 1795, but he had no major hit yet.
Ikku published many illustrated books of popular tales as a professional writer since 1795, but he had no major hit yet.
Ikku published many illustrated books of popular tales as a professional writer since 1795, but he had no major hit yet.

sen.j: この滑稽本の初編は、享和2年（1802年）正月に、村田屋治郎兵衛が出版した。
sen.e: The first edition of this book of comical stories was published by Jirobe MURATAYA in January of 1802.
The first edition of this book of comical stories was published by Jirobe MURATAYA in January of 1802.
The first edition of this book of comical stories was published by Jirobe MURATAYA in January of 1802.

sen.j: 一九が、挿絵を描き、版下の清書もするという安直さに、乗ったらしい。
sen.e: He got interested because Ikku offered to draw the illustrations as well as to write the final draft for printing himself, making the process inexpensive.
He got interested because Ikku offered to draw the illustrations as well as to write the final draft for printing himself, making the process inexpensive.
He got interested because Ikku offered to draw the illustrations as well as to write the final draft for printing himself, making the process inexpensive.

sen.j: 当たったので、翌年、続編を出した。
sen.e: It was a great hit, therefore the next volume was published the following year.
It was a great hit, therefore sequels were published the following year.
sen.cmt: 次文の内容からして、この「続編」は1作ではなかったはずです。
sen.e: It was a great hit, therefore sequels were published the following year.

sen.j: 書名はそれぞれ『浮世道中 膝栗毛』『道中膝栗毛 後篇 乾坤』で、『東海道中 膝栗毛』の外題になったのは、つぎの第3編からであった。
sen.e: The title of the books were "Ukiyodochu Hizakurige" (foot travelers on the road in the floating world) and "Dochu Hizakurige Kohen Kenkon" (sequel to foot travelers on the road, first and second volumes), respectively, and the name of the book became "Tokaidochu Hizakurige" from the third volume that followed.

The title of the books were "Ukiyodochu Hizakurige" (foot travelers on the road in the floating world) and "Dochu Hizakurige Kohen Kenkon" (sequel to foot travelers on the road, first and second volumes), respectively, and the name of the book became "Tokaidochu Hizakurige" from the third volume that followed.

The title of the books were "Ukiyodochu Hizakurige" (foot travelers on the road in the floating world) and "Dochu Hizakurige Kohen Kenkon" (sequel to foot travelers on the road, first and second volumes), respectively, and the name of the book became "Tokaidochu Hizakurige" from the third volume that followed.

sen.j: そして、『東海道中』シリーズは、文化6年（1809年）の第8編（大阪見物）で一段落したが、文化11年（1814年）に、旅立ちの発端（はじまり）の編が、追いかけて出された。
sen.e: The "Tokaidochu" series ended in 1809 with the eighth volume (Sightseeing in Osaka), but there was a follow-up publication in 1814 of a volume on the inception of the trip.
The "Tokaidochu" series ended in 1809 with the eighth volume (Sightseeing in Osaka), but there was a follow-up publication in 1814 of a volume on the inception of the trip.
The "Tokaidochu" series ended in 1809 with the eighth volume (Sightseeing in Osaka), but there was a follow-up publication in 1814 of a volume on the inception of the trip.

sen.j: 序編が、最後に書かれたのである。
sen.e: The prologue was written last.
The prologue was written last.
The prologue was written last.

sen.j: 一九は、頻繁に取材の旅をした。
sen.e: Ikku traveled often to do research for his stories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ikku traveled often to do research for his stories.
Ikku traveled often to do research for his stories.

sen.j: しかし、京都は未見で、「名所図絵」などによったのではと言われる。
sen.e: However, he never saw Kyoto, and it is said that he probably used 'Meisho Zue" (encyclopedia of famous places).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he never saw Kyoto, and it is said that he probably used 'Meisho Zue" (encyclopedia of famous places).
However, he never saw Kyoto, and it is said that he probably used 'Meisho Zue" (encyclopedia of famous places).

sen.j: 狂歌が多くはさまれている。
sen.e: Many kyogen verses are included.
Many kyogen verses are included.
Many kyogen verses are included.

sen.j: 狂言、浄瑠璃、歌舞伎、浮世草子、落語、川柳などに関する彼の素養が、篇中に生かされている。
sen.e: His talent in kyogen, joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a shamisen accompaniment), kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), ukiyozoshi (books of the floating world), rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and senryu (humorous or ironical haiku (poems made of five-seven-five syllables) verses) is utilized in the books.

His talent in kyogen, joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a shamisen accompaniment), kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), ukiyozoshi (books of the floating world), rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and senryu (humorous or ironical haiku (poems made of five-seven-five syllables) verses) is utilized in the books.

His talent in kyogen, joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a shamisen accompaniment), kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), ukiyozoshi (books of the floating world), rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) and senryu (humorous or ironical haiku (poems made of five-seven-five syllables) verses) is utilized in the books.

sen.j: 長編としての一貫性がととのっているとは、言い難い。
sen.e: It is hard to say that there is consistency as a long story.
It is hard to say that there is consistency as a long story.
It is hard to say that there is consistency as a long story.

sen.j: 一九はさらに『続膝栗毛』シリーズを書き、弥次喜多は、金刀比羅宮、厳島神社、木曽地域、善光寺、草津温泉、中山道へと膝栗毛し、21年後にようやく完結した。
sen.e: Ikku additionally wrote "Zoku Hizakurige" series, and Yajikita traveled to Kotohira-gu Shrine, Itsukushima-jinja Shrine, Kiso region, Zenko-ji Temple, Kusatsu-onsen hot spring and Nakasen-do Road, and the book finally concluded 21 years later.

Ikku additionally wrote "Zoku Hizakurige" series, and Yajikita traveled on foot to Kotohira-gu Shrine, Itsukushima-jinja Shrine, Kiso region, Zenko-ji Temple, Kusatsu-onsen hot spring and Nakasen-do Road, and the book finally concluded 21 years later.
sen.cmt: 「膝栗毛する」は「徒歩旅行する」の意であると解釈して修正しました。
sen.e: Ikku additionally wrote "Zoku Hizakurige" series, and Yajikita traveled on foot to Kotohira-gu Shrine, Itsukushima-jinja Shrine, Kiso region, Zenko-ji Temple, Kusatsu-onsen hot spring and Nakasen-do Road, and the book finally concluded 21 years later.

sen.j: 出版の経年的なデータを、初刷本のデータにまとめる。
sen.e: Information on publications over time is summarized using information from the first printings.
Information on publications over time is summarized using information from the first printings.
Information on publications over time is summarized using information from the first printings.

sen.j: 版元は、第4編まで『通油町 村田屋治郎兵衛』であった。
sen.e: The publisher was "Tori abura-cho Murataya Jirobe" until the fourth volume.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The publisher was "Tori abura-cho Murataya Jirobe" until the fourth volume.
The publisher was "Tori abura-cho Murataya Jirobe" until the fourth volume.

sen.j: しかし、第5 - 8編には、江戸の『本石町二丁目 西村源六』・『通油町 靏（鶴）屋喜右衛門』と、大阪の『心斎橋唐物町 河内屋太助』も加わった。
sen.e: However, publishers for volumes five through eight were "Hongoku-cho Nichome Nishimura Genroku" and "Tori abura-cho Tusuruya Kiemon" of Edo in addition to "Shinsaibashi Karamonomachi Kawachiya Tasuke" of Osaka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, for volumes five through eight,"Hongoku-cho Nichome Nishimura Genroku" and "Tori abura-cho Tusuruya Kiemon" of Edo and "Shinsaibashi Karamonomachi Kawachiya Tasuke" of Osaka also participated as publishers.
sen.cmt: 版元の交代ではなく追加として訳し直しました。
sen.e: However, for volumes five through eight,"Hongoku-cho Nichome Nishimura Genroku" and "Tori abura-cho Tusuruya Kiemon" of Edo and "Shinsaibashi Karamonomachi Kawachiya Tasuke" of Osaka also participated as publishers.

sen.j: 後発の『発端』のそれは、『馬喰町二丁目角 西村屋與八』であった。
sen.e: The publisher of the later volume on "the inception" was "Bakuro-cho Nichome kado Nishimuraya Yohachi."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The publisher of the later volume on "the inception" was "Bakuro-cho Nichome kado Nishimuraya Yohachi."
The publisher of the later volume on "the inception" was "Bakuro-cho Nichome kado Nishimuraya Yohachi."

sen.j: 『通油町』は、現在の中央区 (東京都)日本橋大伝馬町である。
sen.e: Tori abura-cho is present-day Nihonbashi Odenma-cho in Chuo Ward, Tokyo.
Tori abura-cho is present-day Nihonbashi Odenma-cho in Chuo Ward, Tokyo.
Tori abura-cho is present-day Nihonbashi Odenma-cho in Chuo Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 挿絵は、『発端』の喜多川式麿のほかは、ほとんど一九の自画である。
sen.e: Except for the ones in "the inception" by Shikimaro KITAGAWA, most of the illustrations were drawn by Ikku himself.
Except for the ones in "the inception" by Shikimaro KITAGAWA, most of the illustrations were drawn by Ikku himself.
Except for the ones in "the inception" by Shikimaro KITAGAWA, most of the illustrations were drawn by Ikku himself.

sen.j: 文化6年（1809年）発行の第8編末の広告に、「版木が減ったので、初編を再板」する旨が、すでに記されている。
sen.e: In an advertisement at the end of volume eight published in 1809, the intention of 'publishing the first volume again because there is a shortage of printing blocks' was already noted.
sen.cmt: 「版木が減ったので、初編を再板」の意味不明
sen.e: In an advertisement at the end of volume eight published in 1809, the intention of 're-engraving the first volume because printing blocks have worn down' was already noted.
sen.cmt: 版木が減るとは「擦り減る」の意と解釈して修正しました。
sen.e: In an advertisement at the end of volume eight published in 1809, the intention of 're-engraving the first volume because printing blocks have worn down' was already noted.

sen.j: ヒット作ゆえに、古版木を加工したり、版木を彫りなおしたりの異本は多かった。
sen.e: Because the series was a big hit, there were many alternative versions that were published by engraving used printing blocks or re-engraving printing blocks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the series was a big hit, there were many alternative versions that were published by engraving used printing blocks or re-engraving printing blocks.
Because the series was a big hit, there were many alternative versions that were published by engraving used printing blocks or re-engraving printing blocks.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）の改版が知られ、その後も翻刻が重ねられて来た。
sen.e: The reprinting in 1862 is known, and there were repeated reprintings since then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The reprinting in 1862 is known, and there were repeated reprintings since then.
